title: Steve Trindall
text:
Steve Trindall born 23 April 1973 in <a href="Wee%20Waa%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Wee Waa, New South Wales</a>, Australia is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s and 2000s. Trindall's position of choice is as a .
He played for the <a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a>, the <a href="North%20Sydney%20Bears">North Sydney Bears</a>, the <a href="Northern%20Eagles">Northern Eagles</a> and the <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a> in Australia. In the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a> he played for the and also played for <a href="Whitehaven%20R.L.F.C.">Whitehaven</a>.
Playing career.
Trindall made his first grade debut for Canberra in Round 20 1993 against Cronulla. In 1996, Trindall joined North Sydney and became a regular starter in the team. Trindall played in North Sydney's preliminary final loss against St George.
In 1997, Trindall made 25 appearances as Norths reached the preliminary final against Newcastle. A try by Norths player <a href="Michael%20Buettner">Michael Buettner</a> levelled the scores at 12-12 and halfback <a href="Jason%20Taylor%20%28rugby%20league%29">Jason Taylor</a> had the chance to kick a winning goal with 4 minutes left to play. A normally reliable kicker, Taylor missed the goal that would have sent Norths into their first grade final since 1943. In the following minutes, Newcastle kicked a field goal and scored a late try to win the match 17–12. This was Norths 4th preliminary final defeat in 7 years.
In 1998, Norths finished 5th but were eliminated from the finals series after losing to Parramatta and Canterbury. In 1999, Trindall was a member of The North Sydney side which played its final ever first grade game against The <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a> in <a href="Townsville">Townsville</a>.
After Norths merged with arch rivals Manly to form the <a href="Northern%20Eagles">Northern Eagles</a>, Trindall was one of the Norths players signed to join the new team. Trindall made 44 appearances for the club before departing the team to join <a href="Wests%20Tigers">Wests Tigers</a>. Trindall then went on to play with Wests for 2 seasons before leaving the club in 2003 to join the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a>.
Trindall played 64 times for London between 2003 and 2006 before finishing his career with Whitehaven.
